text:
The build process fails on kaffe 1.0.7 in the buildstrap since ant requires
Sun's compiler (com.sun.something). Free java virtual machines usually don't
implement com.sun.* classes so it would be better if ant checked for other
supported compilers like kjc & jikes were available instead of failing because
it can't find sun's javac.
creator: robilad@yahoo.com

text:
It is unnecessary to further complicate the bootstrap since it is for 
development only, plus you won't even be able to compile all classes if you 
don't have com.sun.*... so you're not going very far in development IMHO...
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
sbailliez@apache.org
text: I forgot to say that I degraded to enhancement...it's in no way major.

Stephane,

regarding the "you can't compile all classes argument without com.sun.*"
srgument: you can't, for example, compile the
src/main/org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/optional/sound/AntSoundPlayer.java on a
stock jdk 1.1 from Sun either, you'd need jmf for the javax.sound imports to
work. That shouldn't mean that ant can not be built under jdk 1.1, it only means
that some parts should be (and as far as I know are) compiled conditionally,
depending on the capabilities of the build platform.

Are there any classes used to bootstrap ant which have to use the undocumented
com.sun. classes and interfaces?

Regarding the "it's for development only" argument: developping ant under
alternative platforms can help to expose bugs, as shown by my small patches:
http://archive.covalent.net/jakarta/ant-dev/2002/06/0692.xml
http://archive.covalent.net/jakarta/ant-dev/2002/06/0693.xml

Currently, I have the bootstrap process failing because bootstrap.sh does not
specify all files required to rebuild ant. It relies on the compiler to compile
files from packages that are not passed to it on the command line. That doesn't
work with compilers that adhere strictly to the JLS, as it doesn't say what the
compiler is supposed to do when a type is used that is not reachable: some
compilers try to figure out where these types might be and recompile them (like
javac does), other like kjc don't, while jikes is somewhere in between.
creator: robilad@yahoo.com

text:
I'm fine with this if you can provide a patch for jikes (that works as well

I don't think it is a negligible effort though, but I might be wrong.
